title: Variable definition
explanation: Ruby does not use `var` to define variables. Simply use `x = 10`.

title: Comment syntax
explanation: Yes, Ruby uses `#` for single-line comments.

title: Function definition
explanation: Ruby uses `def` to define methods, not `function`.

title: String interpolation
explanation: Yes, `#{}` is used for interpolation in double-quoted strings.

title: If statement syntax
explanation: Ruby `if` statements do not use braces `{}`. They are terminated by `end`.

title: Constant assignment
explanation: Ruby constants start with uppercase letter, but `const` keyword is not used (unlike JS). Just `MyConst = 10`.

title: Block syntax
explanation: Parentheses `()` cannot be used for blocks like `{}`. Should be `3.times { |i| puts i }` or `do ... end`.

title: Semicolon usage
explanation:
Semicolons are valid in Ruby but unnecessary at end of line. Not an error. 
Error: `++` operator.

title: Increment operator
explanation: Ruby does not have `++` operator. Use `x += 1`.

title: String concatenation
explanation: Cannot concatenate string and integer directly. Use `to_s` or interpolation.

title: Else if syntax
codeSnippet:
if x > 10
  puts "Big"
else if x > 5
  puts "Medium"
end

title: Instance variable access
codeSnippet:
class Person
  def set_name(n)
    this.name = n
  end
end
explanation: Ruby uses `self` (or `@` for instance vars), not `this`. Instance vars are `@name`.

title: Case statement
codeSnippet:
case x
when 1 then puts "One"
else puts "Other"
end

title: Switch statement
explanation: Ruby does not have valid `switch` statement block syntax like C/JS. Use `case`.

title: Foreach syntax
codeSnippet:
foreach x in arr
  puts x
end
explanation: Ruby uses `for x in arr` or `arr.each`. `foreach` is not a keyword.

title: Try catch block
explanation: Ruby uses `begin`...`rescue`, not `try`...`catch`. (`catch`/`throw` exists but for control flow, not exceptions, and syntax differs).

title: Private visibility syntax
codeSnippet:
class C
  private function f() end
end
explanation: `function` keyword invalid (use `def`). `private` is a method call or modifier, not a keyword like Java's `private void`. Correct: `private` then `def f` or `private :f`.

title: Constructor name
codeSnippet:
class C
  def C()
  end
end
explanation: Ruby constructor is named `initialize`, not class name.

title: Boolean not
explanation:
`!` is valid. `not` is valid. 
Error: `===` usage? Valid. 
Error: undefined method on nil.

title: Length property
explanation:
Valid syntax. Parentheses optional. 
Error: `s.len`? 
Error: `array.count` vs `length`. 
Let's use `size` property access from other langs.

title: Array access syntax
explanation: Array access uses `[]`, e.g., `arr[0]`. `arr(0)` attempts to call method `arr`.

title: Do while loop
explanation: Ruby does not have `do ... while`. Has `loop do ... break` or `begin ... end while`.

title: Logical AND word
description: Identify precedence confusion attempt or invalid.
explanation: `and` is valid in Ruby (lower precedence). Capital `AND` is NOT a keyword.

title: Exit function
explanation: Ruby uses `exit`. `quit` might work in IRb but not standard script? `exit` is correct.

title: BreakWith
explanation: To return value from block break: `break 5`. `with` keyword not used there.

title: Module method access
codeSnippet:
module M
  def f
    puts "Hi"
  end
end
M.f
explanation: Instance method `f` in module cannot be called directly on module `M`. Needs `def self.f` (module function) or `extend self` or inclusion.

title: String multiply
explanation: String multiplication expects an integer. `"Hi" * 3` works. `"3"` is string.

title: Double dot range
explanation:
Float ranges are valid. 
Error: `do` missing in for loop? valid without. 
Error: `private` class? 
Code: `private class C`.

title: Private class definition
explanation: `private` modifier affects methods, not class definitions (unless inside another class/module context where access control applies to constants/methods, but `private class C` syntax itself isn't standard like Java). It makes `C` a private constant?

title: Elsif space
codeSnippet:
if x
else if y
end

title: Hash key missing colon
explanation: Syntax error. New hash syntax `key: 1` or old `m => 1`. `key 1` is invalid.

title: Self in main
explanation:
`self` in main is `main` object. Valid. 
Error: `super` outside method/class. valid? 
Code: `super`

title: Super outside method
explanation: `super` is only valid inside a method definition.

title: Method argument default space
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `def f(x=1 y=2)`. Comma missing.

title: Argument separator
explanation: Arguments must be separated by commas.

title: Return in block
explanation:
Returns from enclosing method. Valid if in method. LocalJumpError if top level. 
Assume top level. 
Error: `break` with argument in `while`. 
Code: `while true; break 1; end`.

title: Break return value in while
explanation:
`break` with value in `while` loop is valid in Ruby? It returns `1` from the while expression. Yes valid. 
Error: `continue` keyword.

title: Redo keyword
codeSnippet:
loop do
  redo if condition
end

title: Protected method property
explanation: Protected methods can only be called by objects of the same class (or subclasses), not from outside/public context.

title: Hash assignment syntax
explanation: Invalid hash syntax. Use `:a => 1` or `a: 1`. Not `=`.

title: Double pipe equals space
explanation: `||=` must be together. `| |=` is syntax error.

title: Yield arguments count
codeSnippet:
def f
  yield 1
end
f { |a, b| }
explanation:
Ruby blocks are lenient with arguments. `b` becomes nil. No error. 
Error: Call method with wrong args. 
Code: `def f(x); end; f()`.

title: Argument count mismatch
explanation: ArgumentError: wrong number of arguments (given 0, expected 1).

title: Include vs Extend
codeSnippet:
module M; end
class C
  uses M
end
explanation: `uses` is not a keyword. Use `include` or `extend` (or `prepend`).

title: Unless else syntax
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `elseif` in unless? 
Code: `until ...` mismatch.

title: Catch keyword usage
explanation:
Repeated syntax error check (JS style). 
Let's use `raise` vs `throw`. 
Code: `throw Exception.new`.

title: Throw exception
explanation: In Ruby, `raise` is used for exceptions. `throw` is for control flow (with `catch` blocks). Raising an exception via `throw` is incorrect/UncaughtThrowError (unless caught).

title: Global constant reassignment
explanation: Reassigning constant produces a warning (not strictly an error, but usually considered bad/error in strict context). Warning: already initialized constant C.

title: Percent string syntax
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `%list`? 
Code: `%i( a b c )` (symbol array). 
Code: `%x` (shell). 
Code: `%invalid`.

title: Spaceship operator missing
explanation: Spaceship operator `<=>` must not have spaces.

title: Float no leading zero
explanation: Ruby requires leading zero for floats `0.5`, unlike C/JS.

title: Variable starts with number
explanation: Variable names cannot start with a number.

title: Block parameter conflict
explanation:
Shadowing. Valid. 
Error: `return` value in void context? 
Code: `def f; return 1, 2; end`. Valid (array). 
Code: `x = return 1`. Invalid.

title: Class method definition syntax
explanation:
Valid if C exists. 
Error: `def self.method`. 
Code: `def 1.method` (singleton). Valid. 
Code: `def method-name`.

title: Refine keyword
codeSnippet:
module M
  refine String do
  end
end

title: Inherit from module
codeSnippet:
module M; end
class C < M
end
explanation: Class cannot inherit from a module. Must include/extend.

title: Unexpected comma end
explanation:
`x = 1,` creates an array `[1]`. Next line `y=2`. Not error. 
Error: `puts ,`.

title: Invalid instance var name
explanation: Instance variable cannot start with number after @.

title: Colon placement
explanation: Ruby `if` does not use colon `:` delimiter. Use `then` or newline or `;`.

title: Argument order
explanation:
Optional arguments (defaults) should usually be at end. Before 1.9 error? In valid Ruby, optional can be in middle `f(a=1, b)`. Calls `f(2)` -> a=1, b=2. It is valid. 
Error: `def f(*args, z)` valid (z takes from end). 
Error: `def f(**args, z)`.

title: Arg order kw splat
explanation: Required parameter `p` cannot come after double splat `**k`.

title: Break outside loop
explanation: Invalid break (if is not a loop).

title: Unclosed quote
explanation: Unterminated string meets end of file.

title: Invalid number literal
explanation: Double underscore in number literal is invalid error? No, Ruby allows consecutive underscores? Actually, `1__0` is Syntax error `trailing _`? `1_0` valid. `1__0` syntax error in Ruby.

title: Invalid escape
explanation:
Prints `\q` (or `q`). Not error. 
Error: `\ u` space? `\uHHHH` valid. 
Error: Regexp `/[/`. 
Code: `/[/`.

title: Regexp brackets
explanation: Premature end of regular expression or invalid bracket usage. `[` opens a set.

title: Class name lowercase
explanation: Class names must be constants (start with uppercase). `dog` is invalid.

title: Return arg parens space
explanation:
Valid `3`. 
Error: `f (1)`. Warning/Syntax sometimes. 
Error: `...` in invalid pos.

title: Arguments ellipses
explanation:
Argument forwarding `...` is valid in Ruby 2.7+. 
Error: mixing `...` and `args` improperly? 
Code: `def f(..., x)`.

title: Rest arg placement
explanation: Cannot have multiple splat parameters `*a` and `*b`.

title: Array trailing comma
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `,` start. 
Error: `(1,)` tuple style? `(1,)` is valid parenthesis around `1,`? `1,` is valid? No. `x = 1,` -> array. 
Code: `x = 1,, 2`.

title: Object clone syntax
explanation: `clone` is a method. `obj.clone`. `clone obj` calls `clone(obj)`. `Object#clone` takes no arguments (usually). ArgumentError.

title: Private constant define
explanation: `private` does not apply to constant assignment on same line like this. Use `private_constant :CONST` after assignment.

title: Invalid symbol characters
explanation: Symbol with hyphen requires quotes `:'invalid-symbol'`. As bare identifier, subtraction.

title: Raise without args
explanation:
Valid (re-raises current exception or RuntimeError). 
Error: `alias` with comma. 
Code: `alias a, b`.

title: Alias comma
explanation: `alias` takes two arguments separated by space, NOT comma (comma syntax is for `alias_method` which is a method call). Keyword `alias` is space-separated.

title: Module function argument
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `private` block argument? `private { }` invalid? No. 
Error: `undef` comma? `undef :a, :b` valid? No, undefined? `undef` takes names. 
Code: `undef :a, :b` is Valid?

title: Undef comma
explanation:
Ruby `undef` works with multiple args? `undef a, b`. Yes. 
Let's assume valid. 
Error: `class C < Struct.new(:a)` block syntax missing? Valid. 
Code: `class C < 1` (inherit number).

title: Inherit from Integer
explanation: TypeError: superclass mismatch or cannot inherit from Integer (Class class?). Actually Integer is a class, but some core classes like Integer, Symbol, TrueClass cannot be subclassed.

title: While do syntax
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `for x in arr do` valid. 
Error: `while x :` python syntax.

title: While colon
explanation: Ruby does not use colon in while loops.

title: Constant in method
explanation: Dynamic constant assignment (inside method) is invalid (SyntaxError).

title: Double colon method missing class
explanation:
Calls `f` in top level. Valid. 
Error: `Object::` on nothing. 
Error: `1::to_s`. 
Code: `1::to_s`.

title: Colon call on literal
explanation: `::` is for constant/class/module access, not instance method calls. Use `.`.

title: Private visibility block
explanation: `private` does not take a block `{}` (it's not valid syntax for the modifier in most versions, though `private begin ... end` might parse, `private` applies to subsequent methods or as method call). `private` followed by block is likely syntax error or warning depending on version/parser.

title: Method define singleton
explanation:
Valid (monkey patching singleton static method). 
Error: `def (1+1).m`. 
Error: `class << 1` (Fixnum singleton). 
Code: `class << 1`.

title: Singleton class of integer
explanation: TypeError: can't define singleton (or open singleton class) for immediate value (Integer/Symbol).

title: Argument trailing comma definition
explanation: Trailing comma in method definition argument list is syntax error (unless multiline optional in some versions, but usually error in simple def).

title: Yield with block
explanation: `yield` yields to the block passed to method. It does NOT accept a block itself like a method call. Syntax error.

title: String literal bad escape
explanation: `\c` is part of control character syntax `\cX`. Alone it might be invalid or just `c`? `\c` at end of string or followed by non-control char? `\c` followed by nothing is error?

title: Invalid octal
explanation: Leading zero implies octal. `9` is invalid octal digit.

title: Invalid character in variable
explanation: Global variable name cannot contain hyphen (parsed as subtraction).

title: BEGIN block lower case
explanation: `BEGIN { }` (uppercase) is pre-execution block. `begin ... end` is exception block. `begin { }` is syntax error (unexpected brace after begin).

title: Alias global invalid
explanation: Cannot alias a global variable to a method name.

title: Def in method
codeSnippet:
def f
  def g; end
end
explanation:
Valid (nested def defines method on class, not local). 
Error: `class` inside method. 
Code: `def f; class C; end; end`.

title: Class inside method
codeSnippet:
def f
  class C
  end
end
explanation: Class definition is not allowed inside a method (dynamic class def requires `Class.new`).

title: Empty case
explanation:
Valid (nil). 
Error: `when` without `case`? `when x` syntax error? 
Code: `when x`.

title: When without case
explanation: `when` must be inside a `case` statement (or used as `case...when`). dangling `when` is syntax error.

title: Module superclass
explanation:
Valid (Object). 
Error: `Module < Class`? 
Code: `class M < Module; end`. Valid? No. Class inherits from Module. User class cannot inherit from Module class directly? `class C < Module`? Technically C becomes a class that is a Module? No. `TypeError: can't make subclass of Module` (it's special).

title: String literal bad unicode
explanation: Unicode codepoint too large (max 10FFFF). Syntax Error.

title: Redefine true
explanation:
Dynamic assignment to constant/reassign? Warning. But `true` is keyword. `TRUE` is constant. `TRUE = false` works (with warning). 
Code: `true = false` (Assignment to keyword).

title: Super in singleton
explanation:
Valid (calls method on Class's superclass i.e. Object/Module). 
Error: `retry` in loop? 
Code: `while true; retry; end`. 
Check: `retry` only valid in `rescue` block in modern Ruby. Used to be valid in loops. Now SyntaxError?

title: Retry outside rescue 2
explanation: `retry` outside of rescue block is InvalidRetry.

title: Module instance variable
codeSnippet:
module M
  @x = 1
  def self.x; @x; end
end
class C
  include M
  def get_x; @x; end
end
C.new.get_x
explanation:
Instance variable `@x` in module definition belongs to the Module object `M` itself, not to instances of classes including `M`. `C.new.get_x` returns `nil` (instance var not initialized in object). Not an error, but logic bug. 
Let's find a syntax error or runtime error for Diff 2. 
Error: `super` with implicit args change. 
Code: `def f(a); super; end` where super expects 2 args. 
Code: `def f(x); super(x, y); end` y undefined.

title: Super argument mismatch
codeSnippet:
class A; def m(a, b); end; end
class B < A
  def m(x)
    super
  end
end
B.new.m(1)
explanation: `super` without arguments passes current arguments `(x)` to parent method `m`, which expects 2 arguments `(a, b)`. ArgumentError.

title: Module function visibility
codeSnippet:
module M
  def f; end
  module_function :f
end
# M.f works. include M; f works (private)?
explanation: Yes, `module_function` makes the instance method private (when included) and creates a public singleton method.

title: Begin rescue else ensure order
explanation: `else` must come *before* `ensure`. Order: begin, rescue, else, ensure, end.

title: Singleton method on symbol
explanation: Syntax/Runtime error: Symbol is immediate/special usage. Actually `def :sym.m` is syntax error? No, might parse as expresson. But usually invalid to define singleton on symbol literal directly in def. `s = :sym; def s.m` raises TypeEror.

title: Refinement scope
codeSnippet:
module R
  refine String do
    def m; end
  end
end
"s".m
explanation: Refinements are lexically scoped. Must use `using R` before calling refined method `m`. NoMethodError.

title: Constant lookup lexical
codeSnippet:
X = 1
class C
  X = 2
end
class C
  def m; puts X; end
end
C.new.m
explanation:
Ruby constant lookup is lexical. `m` sees top-level X = 1 unless `class C` block is reopening where X=2 is defined? 
Actually, separate `class C` blocks share scope? No, scope is per block. 
1st block defines `C::X`. 2nd block `m`. Inside `m`, `X` not found in `C` (lexically). Look up? It finds top-level X = 1. 
Strictly not an error, prints 1. 
Error: `class C < self`. 
Code: `class C < C`.

title: Recursion inheritance
explanation: Cyclic inheritance or Superclass mismatch (cannot inherit from self).

title: Method alias comma
codeSnippet:
def f; end
alias f, g
explanation: `alias` arguments are space separated `alias new old`. `alias f, g` is Syntax Error.

title: Yield from lambda
explanation: `yield` inside lambda yields to the block given to usage context? No, `yield` in lambda yields to the block given to the lambda *creation* context (method). If created at top level (no method/block), LocalJumpError: no block given (yield).

title: Proc return behavior
codeSnippet:
def f
  p = Proc.new { return 10 }
  p.call
  return 1
end
f
explanation:
Returns 10. `Proc.new` return exits enclosing method `f`. Code is valid. 
Error: `lambda { break }` inside method? valid. 
Code: `loop do; next 1; end`. `next` with value? valid.

title: Next from method
explanation: Invalid next (outside loop/iterator). syntax error or LocalJumpError.

title: Ensure return value
codeSnippet:
def f
  return 1
ensure
  return 2
end
explanation:
Valid, but `ensure` return overrides calls. Returns 2. Not error, spotting unexpected behavior? 
Let's assume valid. 
Error: `def f(x:1, x:2)` duplicate keyword. 
Code: `def f(x:1, x:2)`.

title: Struct keyword init
explanation: ArgumentError: wrong number of arguments, or structure mismatch. With `keyword_init: true`, must use `S.new(a: 1)`. `S.new(1)` fails.

title: Percent literals interpolation
explanation: `%w` creates string array *without* interpolation. `#{b}` is literal string `#{b}`. Not an error? Wait, `errorSpotting` usually implies error or bug. If intention is interpolation, use `%W`.

title: Protected method call on other
codeSnippet:
class A
  protected
  def p; end
end
class B
  def call_p(a); a.p; end
end
B.new.call_p(A.new)
explanation: `B` is not subclass of `A`. Protected method `p` cannot be called on `A` instance from `B`.

title: Case equality override
codeSnippet:
class C
  def ===(other); false; end
end
case C.new
when C.new; puts 'match'
else; puts 'no'
end
explanation:
Logic: Prints 'no' because `===` false. Valid. 
Error: `class << C.new` (singleton). Valid. 
Code: `class << nil`. 
Code: `def f(a); end; f(a: 1)`. Argument mismatch (keyword vs positional).

title: Keyword to positional mismatch
explanation: Passing keyword args to method accepting only positional. In Ruby 3+, this is ArgumentError (no implicit conversion of hash).

title: Argument forwarding invalid
explanation: Argument forwarding `...` must be present in definition `def f(...)` to be used in body.

title: Invalid next value
explanation:
`next 1, 2` returns `[1, 2]`? Valid (array). 
Error: `lambda { |a| }`. call with 0 args? Lambda checks args strict. 
Code: `l = ->(x){}; l.call`.

title: Lambda arg strictness
explanation: Lambda is strict on arguments. ArgumentError: wrong number of args (0 for 1).

title: Hash default proc assign
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `h = Hash.new([])`. `h[:a] << 1`. `h[:b]`? Shared array! Logic bug. Diff 2 acceptable? Yes. Shared mutable default.

title: Hash shared mutable default
explanation: Bug: `h[:b]` will be `[1]` because the default object `[]` is shared and mutated. Output `[1]` unexpected for empty key.

title: Singleton class syntax
codeSnippet:
class << obj
  def m; end
end

title: Private method direct call
codeSnippet:
class C
  private
  def p; end
end
C.new.p

title: Invalid hash key in json syntax
explanation: Symbol syntax `key: val` requires key to be a label/symbol compatible identifier. `1: 2` is syntax error (unexpected colon). Use `1 => 2`.

title: Class var uninitialized
codeSnippet:
class C
  def f; puts @@v; end
end
C.new.f
explanation: NameError: uninitialized class variable `@@v` in C.

title: Splat hash mix
explanation: **nil is valid in 2.x? No, `nil` cannot be splatted into hash? Actually `**nil` is allowed in method call to suppress keyword args, but in hash literal? `TypeError: no implicit conversion of nil into Hash`.

title: Uninitialized constant in module
codeSnippet:
module A; end
module B; include A; end
B::X
explanation: NameError: uninitialized constant B::X (and A::X). Including A doesn't make A's missing constants work, but assumption X doesn't exist.

title: Invalid range
explanation:
Not error, empty array `[]`. Valid. 
Error: `0..nil`. 
Code: `(1..nil)`.

title: Range with nil
explanation:
Range boundaries cannot be nil (ArgumentError: bad value for range). Endless range `1..` valid, but `1..nil` explicit? Actually `1..` is effectively infinite. `1..nil` is valid in Ruby 2.6+ (endless). `nil..1` (beginless) valid 2.7+. 
So `(1..nil)` is valid. 
Error: `*a` in multiple positions. `def f(*a, *b)`. Handled in L1. 
Code: `case; when 1, 2:`. Colon?

title: Beginless range version
explanation:
Valid in 2.7+. 
Error: `...` as literal? `...` used as range. `(1...)` endless exclusive. Valid. 
Code: `x = ...` SyntaxError.

title: Standalone range operator
explanation: `...` (forwarding args) cannot be assigned to variable or used as expression outside range context `start...end` (or argument forwarding). Syntax error.

title: Destructuring mismatch
explanation:
`b` becomes nil. Valid. 
Error: `def f((a, b))`. Nested args. Valid. 
Error: `def f(a: 1, 2)`. Positional after keyword.

title: Positional after keyword arg
explanation: Required positional argument `b` cannot appear after keyword argument `a`.

title: Ensure without begin
explanation:
`ensure` must be associated with a `begin` block or method body. `def f; ensure; end` is valid (implicit begin). 
Code: `if x; ensure; end`. `ensure` in `if`?

title: Ensure in if
explanation: `ensure` is not allowed in `if` block. Only `begin` or `def`.

title: Double splat no hash
explanation: TypeError: no implicit conversion of Integer into Hash (double splat requires hash/hash-like).

title: Yield in define_method
explanation:
`yield` in `define_method` block yields to... the block passed to `define_method`? No, it yields to the block passed to `f` at call time? 
In older Rubies this was issue. In modern, it yields to block passed to `f`. Valid. 
Error: `break` in `define_method` block. 
Code: `define_method(:f) { break }`.

title: Break in define_method
explanation: `break` used in block passed to `define_method` causes LocalJumpError when `f` is called (escapes method).

title: Uninitialized constant in rescue
explanation: NameError: uninitialized constant MyError (if it doesn't exist).

title: Regexp match index
explanation:
Not error, returns nil (index out of bounds). Valid. 
Error: `m['name']` if no named capture? IndexError. 
Code: `m['missing']`.

title: MatchData missing name
explanation: IndexError: undefined group name reference: b.

title: Invalid instance var set
explanation: NameError: `@1` is not allowed as an instance variable name.

title: Private constant access
codeSnippet:
class C
  P = 1
  private_constant :P
end
puts C::P

title: Module undef_method
codeSnippet:
class C
  def m; end
  undef_method :m
end

title: Proc vs Lambda args
codeSnippet:
p = proc { |a, b| a + b }
p.call(1)
explanation: Proc splits args? `a=1, b=nil`. `1 + nil` -> TypeError. (Proc is lenient on count, but body fails).

title: String force_encoding fail
explanation: TypeError: wrong argument type nil (expected Encoding/String).

title: Non-ascii identifier
explanation:
Valid (Ruby supports unicode identifiers). 
Error: `alias` symbol to string? 
Code: `alias :a "b"`. 
Code: `alias :a :b`. Valid? `alias` keyword uses bare words or symbols? `alias :a :b` VALID. `alias a b` VALID sides. 
Code: `alias a :b`. 
Check: `alias` syntax. `alias new old`. `alias :new :old`. 
Error: `undef` string.

title: Undef string
explanation: `undef` requires method name/symbol. String `"m"` is invalid argument.

title: Refine top level
explanation: NoMethodError: undefined method `refine` for main (Object). Must be in module.

title: Superclass mismatch
codeSnippet:
class C < String; end
class C < Array; end
explanation: TypeError: superclass mismatch (cannot redeclare C with different superclass).

title: Hash new block arg count
explanation:
Hash.new block takes `|hash, key|` (2 args). If 1 arg, `h` is hash, key is ignored? Or strict? 
Ruby blocks usually lenient. `h` is hash. Valid. 
Error: `Hash.new` arg + block? 
Code: `Hash.new(1) { }`.

title: Hash new arg and block
explanation: ArgumentError: wrong number of arguments (cannot provide both default value and block).

title: Refinement import
explanation:
Yes (Module#import_methods or similar? Wait. `import_methods`? No. `include`? `using`? `import_methods` is not StdlIb? 
`Module#include` `prepend`. 
Maybe `import` in some DSL? 
Let's switch to `Module#private_class_method`.

title: Yield args mismatch strict
codeSnippet:
def f; yield 1; end
f { |a, b| }
explanation:
Valid (b nil). 
Error: `lambda` strictness again but via yield? 
Code: `def f; yield 1; end; f(&->(a,b){})`.

title: Lambda block wrapping
explanation: ArgumentError: lambda requires 2 arguments, yield provided 1.

title: Immutable object modifying
explanation: FrozenError/cant set var: Symbols are frozen/immediate. Cannot set instance vars on them (in most versions).

title: Next in define_method
explanation:
`next` in method usually returns from block -> return from method? `next` in `define_method` block returns from the block (which is the method body), effectively returning `1`. Valid. 
Error: `redo` in define_method? 
Code: `define_method(:f) { redo }`. Loops forever? Not error. 
Code: `x = { "a": 1, "a" => 2 }` mixed syntax.

title: Mixed hash label syntax
explanation:
JSON style `"key": 1` is valid in Ruby 2.2+. 
Error: `:"key" => 1` valid. 
Code: `=> 1`.

title: Invalid heredoc identifier
explanation: Missing identifier for heredoc `<<-`. EOF or identifier required.

title: Range flip flop misuse
explanation:
Strictly speaking valid (Range of booleans). `flip-flop` is only in if/conditional. As range, invalid? No, `Range.new(true, false)` works. 
Error: `alias` in method scope? Valid. 
Code: `alias method variable`. `variable` is not a method name. 
Code: `def f; a=1; alias m a; end`. `a` is local var.

title: Alias local variable
codeSnippet:
def f
  val = 1
  alias m val
end
explanation: `alias` requires method names (symbols or barewords). `val` refers to local variable (if not method). If ambiguity, still likely fails or `NameError` if `val` method missing.

title: Invalid unicdoe escape
explanation: Invalid hex string in unicode escape.

title: String scan memory
explanation: `scan` returns a new array of all matches. For a massive string, this creates a massive array, potentially causing OOM. Use `scan(/./) { |m| ... }` block form to avoid array allocation.

title: Module class variable sharing
codeSnippet:
module M; @@v = 1; end
class C; include M; end
# C.class_variable_get(:@@v) == 1
explanation: True. Class variables defined in a module are shared with classes that include that module. (This is generally considered a bad practice due to sharing state, but it is how Ruby works).

title: Signal trap handler return
explanation: `return` inside a `trap` block (which is essentially a proc called from signal handler) is invalid because there is no method to return from. It raises a LocalJumpError.

title: Hash compare different types
explanation: False. Symbol key `:a` is different from string key `'a'`. Hashes are not equal.

title: Fiber transfer yield conflict
explanation: `Fiber#transfer` cannot be mixed with `Fiber#resume` / `Fiber.yield` on the same fiber if it wasn't created for transfer. Wait, `transfer` requires `require 'fiber'`. A fiber can use transfer, but mixing `resume` and `transfer` is restricted. Actually, `f.transfer` passes control. Inside, `Fiber.yield` yields back to... `resume` caller. If called with `transfer`, it expects to transfer back. `FiberError: cannot yield from a transferred fiber` (or similar mismatch).

title: Array sort stability
codeSnippet:
class C
  attr_accessor :x, :original_index
  def <=>(other); 0; end
end
# list of Cs...
list.sort!
explanation: Ruby's `sort!` (and `sort`) is not guaranteed to be stable (order of equal elements preserved) across all versions/implementations. Assuming stability can lead to bugs. (Though recent CRuby is stable? Standard says not guaranteed).

title: Regexp match against symbol
explanation: True (or False depending on version). Ruby 2.x return nil? Ruby 3.x? Actually symbols are not strings. `false` or `nil` or `TypeError`. Actually `/a/ =~ :abc` raises TypeError (no implicit conversion of Symbol into String) in modern Ruby.

title: Regexp match symbol correction
explanation: Raises TypeError. Cannot match Regexp against Symbol directly using `=~`.

title: Hash key modification
codeSnippet:
k = "key"
h = { k => 1 }
k.upcase!
p h[k]
explanation: Hash keys that are strings are duplicated and frozen (usually). So modifying `k` generally does not affect the key in the hash. `h[k]` (uppercase K) might not find entry if `k` was mutated? Wait. string key `k` is frozen inside hash? No, a copy is made. `k` outside is mutated. `k` is now "KEY". Hash has "key". `h[k]` looks up "KEY". Returns nil. Logic error.

title: Thread kill resource
explanation: True (code is valid), but dangerous. `t.kill` terminates thread immediately, potentially leaving the file handle open (ensure blocks run? Yes, ensure blocks run on kill).

title: Exception in ensure suppression
codeSnippet:
begin
  raise "Error A"
ensure
  raise "Error B"
end
explanation: Raising in `ensure` allows the new exception ("Error B") to propagate, suppressing the original exception ("Error A"). This makes debugging difficult as the root cause is lost.

title: Splat expansion limit
explanation: True, but hits stack size limit (SystemStackError) likely.

title: Class var inheritance overwrite
codeSnippet:
class Parent
  @@v = 1
end
class Child < Parent
  @@v = 2
end
puts Parent.class_variable_get(:@@v)
explanation: `Child` setting `@@v` overwrites the shared class variable in `Parent` (since they share the same storage key). Output is 2. Often unexpected side effect.

title: Refinement method missing
codeSnippet:
module R
  refine String do
    def method_missing(m, *a); super; end
  end
end
using R
"s".foo
explanation:
Refinements do NOT hook into `method_missing`. Calling missing method on refined class bypasses refinement's `method_missing`? Actually, refinements to `method_missing` are... tricky. In strict mode, `method_missing` in refinement is used? 
Actually, `method_missing` is looked up via dynamic dispatch. If refinement is active, it *should* work? 
Let's assume the error is: `method_missing` is not refined? No. 
Real nuance: Refinements don't support `method_missing` in older Ruby. In 2.4+ they do. 
Let's stick to an easier Diff 3 error. 
Code: `def f(a:); end; args={a:1}; f(**args)` valid. `f(args)` invalid.

title: Explicit hash to keyword args
explanation: Ruby 3.0: Passing Hash directly to keyword arguments without double splat `**` is deprecated/removed. ArgumentError. Must use `f(**{key: 1})` or `f(key: 1)`.

title: Struct pattern matching
codeSnippet:
S = Struct.new(:a)
case S.new(1)
in S[x] then true
end
explanation: True (Ruby 2.7+ pattern matching supports Structs deconstruction).

title: Ensure uses Exception
codeSnippet:
begin
  1/0
rescue
  # handle
ensure
  puts $!.class
end
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `def f; catch(:x) { return }; end`. `return` from catch block returns from method. Valid. 
Code: `throw :x` without catch.

title: Map bang returns nil
explanation: True. `map!` returns the array (even if no changes? No, `map!` always returns array. `compact!` returns nil if no changes).

title: Data modify
explanation: Data objects (Ruby 3.2+) are immutable. `d.x = 2` raises NoMethodError (no setter).

title: Dir chdir block
explanation: True. Changes dir for block, restores after.

title: String comparison nil
explanation: Comparison with nil fails (ArgumentError or similar).

title: Eval malicious string
explanation: Arbitrary code execution. Severe security vulnerability.

title: UnboundMethod bind to subclass
codeSnippet:
class A; def m; end; end
class B < A; end
A.instance_method(:m).bind(B.new).call
explanation: True. Can bind to instance of subclass.

title: Hash rehash missing
explanation: Modifying a key object (array) changes its hash code. The Hash table does not automatically update index. `h[a]` likely returns nil because the key is in the wrong bucket. Need `h.rehash`.

title: Global variables across threads
explanation: True. Global variables are shared across threads (not thread-safe by default).

title: Array delete during iteration
explanation: Modifying array while iterating causes skip. `a` becomes `[2]`. It prints 1, deletes 1. Next index is 1 (value 3). Sees 3, deletes 3. 2 is skipped.

title: Private method in class context
codeSnippet:
class C
  def self.m; new.p; end
  private
  def p; end
end
C.m
explanation: False. `new.p` calls private method `p` on explicit receiver (new instance). Private methods cannot have explicit receiver (prior to Ruby 2.7, even then `self` allowed but `new` is other).

title: Kernel exec replaces process
explanation: `exec` replaces the current process image. The code after `exec` (line 1) is never reached/executed.

title: Range max
explanation: False (or hangs/error). Endless range has no max. `Float::INFINITY` or Error `RangeError`.

title: Float equality
explanation: Floating point arithmetic issues. 0.1+0.2 is 0.30000000000000004. False.

title: OpenStruct limitation
explanation: OpenStruct is slow and has issues if keys clash with Object methods (e.g. `class`, `object_id`? `id` is deprecated/removed in recent Ruby but `object_id` exists). Using `OpenStruct` is generally discouraged in favor of `Struct` or `Data`.

title: Yaml unsafe load
explanation: `YAML.load` (vs `safe_load`) can instantiuate arbitrary classes/remote code execution via deseralization gadgets. Dangerous.

title: System call checking
explanation: `system` returns true/false without raising error on failure. If command is critical, `system(...)` result should be checked, or use built-in library, or `backticks` and check `$?`.

title: Constant assignment in conditional
explanation:
Conditional constant assignment. The constant `CONST` is not defined at parse time? Or is undefined? It works but usually frowned upon? Actually valid. 
Diff 3 Error: `class C; CONST = 1; end; class D < C; CONST = 2; end`. Warning? 
Code: `::TOP = 1`. 
Real Error: `def f; yield; end`. `f(&symbol)`. 
Code: `f(&1)` (invalid proc arg).

title: Block argument type
explanation: ArgumentError (or TypeError): `&` argument must be Proc (or convertible to Proc via `to_proc`). Integer `1` has no `to_proc`.

title: Fiber error handling
explanation: Exception inside Fiber propagates to `resume` caller. If not handled, crashes program. Not strictly 'syntax' error but runtime crash.

title: Method redefine warning
codeSnippet:
def f; end
def f; end
explanation: Redefining method `f`. Ruby will issue a warning. (Not fatal, but Diff 3 spotting warning is good).

title: Enumerable chain
explanation: False. `chain` returns an `Enumerator::Chain` object, not an Array. Need `.to_a` to get `[1, 2]`.

title: Hash sort keys
explanation: `sort` on Hash converts to array `[[:a, 1], [2, 2]]` then sorts. Comparing `[:a, 1]` with `[2, 2]` compares first elements `:a` (Symbol) and `2` (Integer). ArgumentError (comparison of Symbol with Integer failed).

title: String scan infinite
explanation: Empty regex matches empty string between every char. Returns `["", "", ...]`. Wait, does it infinite loop? limit? No, returns array of empty strings. But confusing/unexpected usage.

title: Ensure implicit return
explanation: Returns 1. The value of `ensure` block is discarded (unless explicit return in ensure). Trap for beginners. `f` returns 1, not 2. Error is expecting 2.

title: Clobbered exception in rescue
explanation: `raise e`? If `e` undefined? `rescue => e` needed. Code `rescue; raise e` raises NameError for `e`.

title: Thread variable race
explanation: `a += 1` is not atomic (read, add, write). Race condition means `a` might be less than 10. Needs Mutex.

title: Struct inheritance
explanation: `Struct.new(:a)` defines default `initialize` taking 1 args (or keywords). `super(a, a)` passes 2 arguments. ArgumentError.

title: Enumerable reduce no init
explanation: Reducing empty array without initial value returns `nil`. If user expects 0, logic error. `[].reduce(0, :+)` is safer.

title: Singleton class of nil
explanation:
`nil` is an instance of NilClass. One cannot open singleton class of `nil` (it is a special singleton-ish object). Wait. `nil.singleton_class` works (NilClass). `class << nil` works? Yes, NilClass is singleton. 
Real Error: `class << true` works? 
Code: `def f(a:1, **nil)` works? 
Let's use: `Float::INFINITY.to_i`.

title: String to integer garbage
explanation: Returns `0`. Often leads to silent data corruption if input was expected to be number. Use `Integer("hello")` to raise exception.

title: Constant redefinition warning suppression
explanation: Redefining constant generates warning. To suppress (bad practice but if needed), use `remove_const` first.

title: Protected method visibility from instance
codeSnippet:
class C
  protected
  def m; end
end
C.new.m
explanation: Protected methods can only be called from contexts where `self` is an instance of the class/subclass. `C.new.m` (top level) fails with NoMethodError (protected).

title: Range overlap logic
explanation:
Not error, returns `[4, 5]`. 
Error: `(1..5) & (4..8)`. Range has no `&` method (intersection). TypeError/NoMethodError.

title: Range intersection method
explanation: Range has no `&` method. Must convert to array or use other logic.

title: IO write return
explanation: Returns number of bytes written (integer), not true/nil. Usage often expects bool logic.

title: Alias method bound
codeSnippet:
class C
  def m; puts 1; end
end
class D < C
  def m; puts 2; end
  alias old_m m
end
D.new.old_m
explanation: `old_m` aliases `m` as it is defined *at that point*. In D, `m` is `puts 2`. So `old_m` prints 2. Often user expects to alias Parent's `m`. Use `super` instead.

title: Symbol garbage collection
explanation: Creating unique symbols from user input leads to Symbol DOS (symbols are not GC'd in older Rubies; in execution, table grows). Use string keys or limited set.

title: Dir foreach file handle
explanation:
Valid. 
Error: `File.open` without block? Leaks handle. 
Code: `f = File.open('x'); raise; f.close`. Exception skips close. Leak.

title: Resource leak exception
explanation: File `f` is never closed because exception interrupts flow before `f.close`. Use `File.open { |f| ... }` block.

title: Proc return logic
codeSnippet:
def f(p); p.call; end
f(Proc.new { return 1 })
explanation: LocalJumpError: unexpected return. Proc tries to return from where it was created (top level or different scope?), but f call stack is different? Wait. If created at top level, `return` is invalid (cannot return from top).

title: Thread abort_on_exception default
explanation: Exception is silent (thread dies, main continues) unless `Thread.abort_on_exception = true` or `t.join` is called.

title: Uninitialized class var check
explanation:
Valid (returns false). 
Error: `C.class_variable_get` raises Error if not defined. 
Code: `C.class_variable_get(:@@v)`.

title: Get uninitialized class var
explanation: NameError: uninitialized class variable @@v in C.

title: Frozen string interpolation
explanation: FrozenError. With magic comment, literals are frozen.

title: Yield args array unpacking
codeSnippet:
def f; yield [1, 2]; end
f { |a, b| }
explanation:
Yielding array to block with multiple args: `a` gets 1, `b` gets 2? Or `a` gets `[1, 2]`, `b` nil? 
Ruby 1.8 unpacked. Ruby 1.9+ often does NOT unpack single array arg. `a` is `[1, 2]`. `b` is `nil`. Logic error if unpacking expected.

title: Marshal singleton
explanation: TypeError: can't dump File (or IO, singleton objects, bindings).

title: Superclass mismatch reload
codeSnippet:
class C < A; end
# reload...
class C < B; end
explanation: TypeError: superclass mismatch. Cannot change superclass for existing class C.

title: Object id collision
codeSnippet:
a = Object.new
b = Object.new
a.object_id == b.object_id
explanation: False (usually). Object IDs are unique for live objects.

title: Hash key mutation after store
explanation: Returns nil. `a` hash code changed. Hash bucket invalid.

title: String mutation shared
codeSnippet:
s = "a"
a = [s, s]
s.upcase!
p a
explanation: Output `["A", "A"]`. `s` is shared reference. Mutation affects both.

title: IO foreach line limit
explanation:
Valid argument. 
Error: `String#split` limit? 
Code: `"a,b,c".split(',', 0)`. Valid. 
Code: `"a".split('')` creates chars. 
Real Error: `def f(a=1, b)`. Optional before required.

title: Optional before required arg
explanation:
In Ruby 1.8 this was error. In 1.9+, this IS valid. `f(2)` -> a=1, b=2. 
Diff 3 Warning: `ENV['PATH']`. 
Code: `ENV.fetch('MISSING')` raises KeyError. 
Real Error: `(1..5).step(0)`. Step can't be 0.

title: Regexp timeout
explanation: ReDoS (Catastrophic Backtracking). Regexp engine takes exponential time.

title: String crypt deprecated
explanation: `String#crypt` is deprecated/removed? Actually platform dependent, often unavailable or insecure.
